result.execSummary:
The defendant Riley J. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

6 months conditional jail, consecutive to jail time in 12CF56.  Jail may be served in any county jail that will accept.  Huber/EMP eligibility.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.  Submit to testing on demand of blood, breath or urine to monitor compliance.

Submit to AODA assessment and comply with all recommendations.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any other treatment at the recommendation of the agent.  

Pay costs, including DNA surcharge, as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.Costs.  

DNA sample to be submitted at the Richland County Jail before signing up for probation.  


Consecutive to: 12CF56

timeConds.notes:
With huber and EMP eligibility.  May be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.
Consecutive to: 12CF56

supervisions.notes: With the 270 days credit stipulated to by counsel and ordered by the Court, this is essentially a TIME SERVED SENTENCE. Costs from the original JOC have been converted to a civil judgment owed by the Defendant to the Clerk of Court with all allowable measures to be used by the Clerk of Court to collect this money.

from DOC - provided to the clerk by the agent re DOC offender status

14CF21, 18CM4, 18CM55, 18CM57, 18TR16, and 18TR17 called together. Defendant Riley J. Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties' agreement stated: In 14CF21, parties jointly recommend 12mo in county jail with 270 days credit which would be a time-served sentence. In remaining matters, parties jointly recommend  years probation with TC as a condition of probation. In 18CM4, Def will plead to Count 1 for imposed and stayed 65 days in county jail with all but 14 of those days stayed. Additionally, Def to pay $600 plus costs; DL revocation, 24 months; IID, 24 months; AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed. In 18CM55, Def will plead to Count 1 and parties will jointly recommend 2 years probation. All remaining cases and counts will be dismissed. 

Def pleads guilty to all counts indicated. Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty. 

Court orders sentence as follows:

14CF21 - Count 1- 12mo in county jail with 270 days credit. Essentially, this is a time-served sentence. All remaining costs to be reduced to a civil judgment.  

18CM4 - Count 1- 65 days in county jail imposed and stayed with Defendant placed on probation for 2 years. As a condition of probation, defendant must serve 14 days jail. $600 plus costs, 24 mo revocation, 24 mo IID, AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed. Credit in the event of revocation: 32 days. Huber granted. Additionally, Def must attend, pay for, and successfully complete Richland County's TC. 

18CM55 -Count 1- 2 years probation. Costs waived. 

All remaining cases and counts will be dismissed.
Email from agent with attachment of Amended Revocation Order and Warrant- agent states that the start date of the probation was incorrect on the original; case was consecutive to def's other case.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 24, 2018 at 09:15 am.

14CF21, 18CM4, 18CM55, 18CM57, 18TR16, and 18TR17 all called together. Defendant Riley J. Anderson appeared by video means from RC Jail. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Riley J. Anderson. Atty McDougal states there is a global resolution in the works.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for April 24, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Scheduling conference on April 17, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
TCH scheduled for today at 10 not held. Defendant is in custody on a new matter and was not brought to the courtroom for TC.
Treatment Court Hearing on March 7, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Riley Anderson appears in court, in front of the judge and treatment court team for consideration of inclusion in the ATC program. Court states that formal decision on ATC inclusion is still pending and up for further review.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2018 at 10:00 am.

(forwarded to Dispatch, DA, and P/P)

ADDRESS INFO for Riley J. Anderson
Current: 13460 Ryan Dr, Cazenovia, WI 53924 United States  (Effective: 02-09-2016)
Prior: 6522 Lake Road, Windsor, WI 53598 United States
Stipulated Motion to Stay Jail Report Date Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 973.15.

Defendant Riley J. Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Anthony C. Delyea for sentencing after revocation in 12CF56 and status in 14CF21 as well as 12CF96. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

DA Harper states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of these matters.  This Court states that it will not be entering ruling in 12CF96 as that case is assigned to Judge Czajkowski.  

DA states the details of the parties' agreement:  in 12CF96 (Judge C's case), there will be a stipulation for dismissal; in 12CF56, counsel request 12 mo jail with huber and EMP with jail to be served in any county that will accept with 235 days credit and civil judgment for costs. 

Court orders as requested on 12CF56 - 12 mo jail with 235 days credit - huber, EMP, can be served in any county that will accept.  Civil judgment for costs.  Def requests 45 days stay of jail.  Court will allow the stay.  Jail to begin on or before Oct. 26, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  (report at the Richland County Jail)

Proceeding to 14CF21, Court conducts waiver of the prelim. hearing.  No written waiver; waiver conducted orally only.  Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Court follows jt agreement for sentence withheld with 3 years probation, consecutively to sentence in 12CF56.  Conditions of probation:  6 mo jail, consecutive to jail in 12CF56; no possess/consumption of alcohol; testing on demand to monitor compliance; AODA asst and compliance with recommendations; attend, pay for, and successfully complete any other treatment at the recommendation of the agent.  Costs.  Jail to commence as soon as he completes jail in 12CF56.  Felony admonishments provided.  DNA surcharge.  DNA sample to be submitted at the Richland County Jail before signing up for probation.  Jail may be served in any county in the state.
